org.apache.juneau.xml

Class XmlParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.parser.Parser
          • org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParser
            • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlParser

    public class XmlParser
extends ReaderParser
    Parses text generated by the XmlSerializer class back into a POJO model.
    Media types
    Handles Content-Type types: text/xml
    Description
    See the XmlSerializer class for a description of Juneau-generated XML.

      • XML_eventAllocator

        public static final String XML_eventAllocator
        Configuration property: XML event allocator.

        • Data type: Class<? extends XMLEventAllocator>
        • Default: null
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • XmlParserBuilder.eventAllocator(XMLEventAllocator)
        Description:

        Associates an XMLEventAllocator with this parser.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XML_preserveRootElement

        public static final String XML_preserveRootElement
        Configuration property: Preserve root element during generalized parsing.
        Property:
        • Name: "XmlParser.preserveRootElement.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • XmlParserBuilder.preserveRootElement(boolean)
          • XmlParserBuilder.preserveRootElement()
        Description:

        If true, when parsing into a generic ObjectMap, the map will contain a single entry whose key is the root element name.

        Example:

        // Parser with preserve-root-element. ReaderParser p1 = XmlParser .create() .preserveRootElement(true) .build(); // Parser without preserve-root-element (the default behavior). ReaderParser p2 = XmlParser .create() .preserveRootElement(false) .build(); String xml = "<root><a>foobar</a></root>"; // Produces: "{ root: { a:'foobar' }}" ObjectMap m1 = p1.parse(xml, ObjectMap.class); // Produces: "{ a:'foobar' }" ObjectMap m2 = p2.parse(xml, ObjectMap.class);

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XML_reporter

        public static final String XML_reporter
        Configuration property: XML reporter.
        Property:
        • Name: "XmlParser.reporter.c"
        • Data type: Class<? extends XMLReporter>
        • Default: null
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • XmlParserBuilder.reporter(XMLReporter)
        Description:

        Associates an XMLReporter with this parser.

        Notes:
        • Reporters are not copied to new parsers during a clone.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XML_validating

        public static final String XML_validating
        Configuration property: Enable validation.
        Property:
        • Name: "XmlParser.validating.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session property: false
        • Methods:
          • XmlParserBuilder.validating(boolean)
          • XmlParserBuilder.validating()
        Description:

        If true, XML document will be validated.

        See XMLInputFactory.IS_VALIDATING for more info.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public XmlParserBuilder builder()
        Description copied from class: Context
        Creates a builder from this context object.

        Builders are used to define new contexts (e.g. serializers, parsers) based on existing configurations.

        Overrides:
        builder in class Parser
        Returns:
        A new ContextBuilder object.

      • create

        public static XmlParserBuilder create()
        Instantiates a new clean-slate XmlParserBuilder object.

        This is equivalent to simply calling new XmlParserBuilder().

        Note that this method creates a builder initialized to all default settings, whereas builder() copies the settings of the object called on.

        Returns:
        A new XmlParserBuilder object.

      • createSession

        public ReaderParserSession createSession(ParserSessionArgs args)
        Description copied from class: Parser
        Create the session object that will be passed in to the parse method.

        It's up to implementers to decide what the session object looks like, although typically it's going to be a subclass of ParserSession.

        Specified by:
        createSession in class Parser
        Parameters:
        args - Runtime arguments.
        Returns:
        The new session.
